All of the following problems can be reproduced by using this EAR file:
http://www.informatik.fh-wiesbaden.de/~knauf/public/Stateless.ear
As it needs JavaEE5 support, you can test it with JBoss 4.0.5 + EJB3, JBoss 4.2.0 or JBoss 5.0 (serverdefinition plugin can be found at http://www.informatik.fh-wiesbaden.de/~knauf/public)

Created an attachment (id=63258)
Detailed errors for the bug report
Should this bug be marked fixed? Not clear why I am copied. Don't see anything specific to JSF

Still seeing tons of exceptions on importing the EAR file or trying to work with it in wtp-S-2.0RC2-200705301353.zip.

By the way: all facets are those of J2EE 1.4, though they should be JavaEE5

Wolfgang- almost all of this was fixed in bug 190865

Jason, as per our debugging- everything works great in the import of Stateless.ear except for the ejb-jar, which fails because the schema name has a lot of spaces between http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee and http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee/ejb-jar_3_0.xsd .

Created an attachment (id=70230)
patch

This patch normalizes the schemaLocatios and handles the multiple lines case among other things.

Please re-read
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/WTP_PMC_Defect_Review 

Besides needing component lead review/approval, it's unclear how and who tested, and why this is 'major'. 

I'm sure it's all valid, but you need to spell it out for us and/or paint a picture.

This is a major problem because the without this fix the tooling isn't smart enough to various EE module versions.  Thus during import, the wrong project versions are created.  I tested this with JUnits I intend to add to j2ee tests, and with the original test case using the UI to perform an EAR import.

Sorry - A little slow getting to all the reviews...

Justification:

Many user examples use alternate formatting, and without this fix, our utility
will fail to parse correctly, and determine doc type/version.  This is a
crucial scenario.

Review: 

This is a fix to our utility that determines doc version, and wasn't properly
allowing different formatting of the xml header elements...

I have run though our junits to ensure no regressions, and have tried using the
testcase provided.

I approve

The "normalizeSchema" will run into a NPE if the attribute "xsi:schemaLocation" is not present or has spelling error (without showing an error message to the user).
Is not a major problem, but the import should be able to handle this problem I think. I reopen with priority "minor".

From the log file:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-06-09 18:19:19.906
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.jee.util.internal.JavaEEQuickPeek.normalizeSchemaLocation(JavaEEQuickPeek.java:114)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jee.util.internal.JavaEEQuickPeek.getVersion(JavaEEQuickPeek.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.archive.JavaEEArchiveUtilities.refineForJavaEE(JavaEEArchiveUtilities.java:219)

	at org.eclipse.jst.jee.archive.internal.ArchiveImpl.getNestedArchive(ArchiveImpl.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.archive.ArchiveWrapper.getEarModules(ArchiveWrapper.java:228)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.application.internal.operations.EARComponentImportDataModelProvider.getModuleModels(EARComponentImportDataModelProvider.java:455)

Created an attachment (id=70848)
patch for NPE

This is a very simple and safe fix and has been tested both with JUnits and through the UI while attempting to import an EJB jar lacking the schema location.

As stated by Wolfgange, without this patch, anyone with a messed up deployment descriptor will be unable to perform an import.  This patch allows the import to proceed even though the correct version cannot be determined.  The user should then be able to fixup their deployment descriptor.
Also, in Chuck's absence, I am acting as component lead for Java EE tools and am signing off on this fix.

I am approving this as the fix seems very low risk, even though the bug is
probably not severe enough to warrant a change at this time.
Verified against wtp-S-2.0RC3-200706131511.zip: with broken schemaLocation the project is imported with facet "EJB 2.1".
